## Directory of Antique Appraisers in Hartford, Connecticut  

### Overview  
Hartford offers access to professional antique appraisal services through credentialed experts specializing in valuations for insurance claims, estate planning/resale purposes[1][2]. Key providers emphasize localized market expertise combined with flexible evaluation methods (**in-person**, **remote**, or **photo-based**) backed by thorough research into provenance/condition[1][5].  

---

### Antique Appraiser Listings  

#### **Prestige Estate Services**  
- **Specialties**: Fine art | Furniture | Jewelry | Collectibles | IRS/insurance-compliant reports[1][5]  
- **Certifications**: ISA (*International Society of Appraisers*) | ASA (*American Society of Appraisers*)[7]  
- **Years Active**: Over two decades[7]  
- **Service Areas**: Greater Hartford region + statewide coverage (New Haven/Bridgeport/Greenwich)[5]  
- **Pricing**: Starts at ~$150+ depending on method (*photo valuations* cheapest; *onsite visits* higher due to travel/time)[4][6]. Custom quotes available[7].  
- **Contact**: [prestigeestateservices.com](https://prestigeestateservices.com/locations/hartford-connecticut/) | Phone number via website inquiry[9]  
- Hours: By appointment only  

---

### Additional Notes  
While few dedicated firms operate solely within city limits due to market size,**regional/national providers like Winter Associates** also serve Connecticut estates remotely upon request ([auctionsappraisals.com](https://www.auctionsappraisers.com))[10]. For Civil War-era items,**Windham Antiques** offers specialized valuations remotely ([windhamantiquesappaisalservices.com](https://www.windhamantiquesappraisalsservices.com)) despite being Vermont-based[9].  

---

### Key Considerations When Hiring  
Verify credentials via ISA/ASA affiliations for legal defensibility[2], prioritize local expertise (*crucial for regional market trends*)[8], and confirm upfront costs during consultations given variable pricing structures ($100–$900+ depending on scope/complexity)[4][6].
